name: Cabbage Apple Soup
author: mispirit
summary: A flavorful sweet-and-sour cabbage soup. Years ago a local restaurant served a cabbage apple soup that I've been trying to recreate. This is my best attempt, and possibly even better! For a vegetarian version, simply omit the bacon.
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, cut into 1 inch pieces  (Optional)
½  apple, peeled and finely chopped
1 head cabbage, cored and coarsely chopped
directions: Place bacon pieces in a large pot and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Drain fat from the pot and add olive oil, onion, garlic, and caraway seeds
Cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes
Stir in chopped apple, vegetable broth, apple cider, cabbage, cider vinegar, and sugar
Bring soup to a boil and reduce heat to low
Simmer, partially covered, until cabbage is tender, 20 to 30 minutes
Cut bread into large chunks and place them in the bottom of six soup bowls
Ladle the soup over the bread and serve
